title.label: This really is a good game, but...

content.label:
This really is a good game, but it desperately needs updating. I originally purchased it in 2012 and it was flawless and beautiful and fun. 

I‚Äôve offloaded and reloaded it over the years (it does take up quite a bit of space) and I decided to load it again for something fun to do (you know, Covid and all).  I was so disappointed to find it doesn‚Äôt work with iOS 14. I didn‚Äôt bother to notice that the last update was 2 years ago. 

The biggest issue is there is no sound at all. This game relies on listening to the dialogue of the characters. 

Please please please update!

title.label: Worst game I have ever played

content.label: Save your money.  This game is worthless as far as puzzle games go.  It could have promise if it wasn‚Äôt so glitchy.  The controls take some getting used to but even then they have their quirks.  The most irritating thing in the game is the short time limit that you have to get to the next objective.  It would be nice to be able to explore and talk the characters without you getting arrested so quickly.

There is this bug that is in the game that cause the time in the story to move faster than the actual story this means I can‚Äôt catch up when something‚Äôs happening. For example. During the story when you arrive at Munich. The game thinks you actually at Munich saying that you failed to give the gold august Schmidt even though the concert is still going with august Schmidt in the concert. That‚Äôs what I mean. So can you please fix this bug

title.label: Massvely Great Game , concept and design

content.label: Love this game. i know and worked with  the people who wrote it.

title.label: Critical bug ends game halfway through.

content.label:
Critical bug: Concert never finishes so Cath never gets to have his crucial conversation with Schmidt. Our hero is dead halfway through the game. 
It's a shame as this is a beautiful game.

title.label: Classic Game - Please make a new version

content.label:
I loved this game 20 years ago when it first came out, and still do. Thank you for bringing it back.  

My only wish is the game play itself be updated for 2019/2020 with all new graphics and perhaps even a whole new story. One can hope right? üôè
This is a great classic game, but the software hasn‚Äôt been updated in a long time so bugs persist. In addition to a clunky fight scene, the concert now never ends.
Loving the game, but the controls are very difficult. Especially during the fight scenes. It‚Äôs a bit frustrating.
The app had a glitch so that there was no sound. Much of this game relies on sound. Couldn‚Äôt play it.

Are usually don‚Äôt download games that haven‚Äôt had any updates in a year. I broke my rule, and I shouldn‚Äôt have. Granted, I am on a iPhone 6S, but I just can‚Äôt move around in the game. I can‚Äôt tell what‚Äôs a door and what‚Äôs a hallway. Clunky mechanics don‚Äôt help.

I really enjoy playing The last express so bringing this game to mobile is great, so I decided to replay it then I noticed a glitch where Anna won‚Äôt talk to August in the restaurant car she just stands by the door 

Can this please be fixed?

I am not sure how to do this game justice in a review.  How do you adequately praise a work of art?  This is the closest thing to time travel I‚Äôve probably ever encountered.  If you‚Äôve never wanted to take a train across Europe in the days before WWI, you may not enjoy this game, and that‚Äôs fine.  But if you ever have thought, ‚ÄúGee, that would be neat,‚Äù this game is the closest you‚Äôll get.  Some of the gameplay is challenging, even frustrating.  But this is a big, Art Nouveau astronomical clock of a game, with so many moving parts‚Äîreally as immersive as anything I‚Äôve played.  The passengers on the train each have their own stories, and speak their own languages (Russian, French, German, Serbian!).  At one point you must have a character translate a golden manuscript of The Firebird into English from Russian.  The conversations between the socialist student and the Count‚Äôs granddaughter, or between the English girl and her Central European companion, are just exactly right.  If you love travel or history, if you love art or character, try this game.  If these things do not excite you, enjoy the thousands of other games that are made for people with no appetite for the extraordinary.  If only there were more games with this much imagination.

title.label: Great game, but needs to be updated for iOS 12

content.label: I became absolutely hooked on this game. It has everything I love in a point-and-click adventure game: intriguing storyline, good character interaction, challenging (but not impossibly hard) puzzles, and phenomenal voice acting. The real-time storyline makes it even more interesting. I would give the game itself 5 stars...BUT about halfway through, there is a bug that makes it impossible to complete the game (concert scene never ends, just goes on for hours even though all tasks have been completed). I can only guess that this is a glitch with iOS 12, as the game was last updated for iOS 11. Contacted the developers, no reply...seriously disappointing to not even be able to finish the game after paying for it and investing so much time in it!
Pretty, runs great, interesting stories and characters.

There is nothing else like this game, a neglected classic brought back to life, flawed in places because it tried to tell a complex story in a new way. There aren't many places to go but everything around you changes as time passes. It can be frustrating to miss an event by being in the wrong place at the wrong time, or neglecting to recheck a location that was empty the first time you looked. But there are clues in the overheard conversations, and if you fail the rewind mechanism takes you back to a point where you can still win. It's a great story, memorable characters and more true emotion than many games.

(Thankfully the developer has finally updated the iOS version so it runs on the latest iOS. So this lost classic comes back from the dead yet again.)
Thanks for bringing this amazing classic to iOS

I would love to play this again on an iPhone 8 Plus screen!!! Such a delightful game that shouldnt be forgotten!

**UPDATE**

I did not expect to see this on my 8 plus, but you guys delivered!!!

Can‚Äôt wait to play this through again ‚Äî thanks!!!

(Now get on that LBA sequel I‚Äôve been pestering for!!)
Game is great! But needs to be updated by the developer to be used in iOS 11. Thanks!

title.label: Needs update to iOS 11, 64 bit support.

content.label: Excellent game, needs to be made comparable with iOS 11, this Awsome game can't be allowed to disappear and be forgotten just because Apple updates their iOS to 64 bit.

title.label: Love this game, so PLEASE UPDATE IT!

content.label: I love this game and would hate to lose it when iOS 11 comes out. Please please please update the app DotEmu!!!!
Great story line, interesting characters, very intriguing and addictive. Not too long or short.Can you please make a sequel? I would like to see another ending.
The game takes a while to download but I'm sure from everyone's reviews it's going to be awesome
Amazing music, great story!
I love this game but I can't even get past the first 5mins, once I enter the dining car I'm unable to move! No controls just stands there, want a refund

title.label: This is my favorite PC game now iOS

content.label: I loved this game as a kid and now I can play it on the go :D

title.label: Great Game! If You Like Myst, This Game's For You

content.label: It is a really nice game with a great story. Definitely worth about 2-3 play throughs. There are times when I wish the graphics were a little more fluid and higher quality, but everything else makes up for those things.
I bought this game 15 years ago at a media play for $5 out the bargain bin. Never got to finish it because I last the last disk. Can't wait to play it all over again.

title.label: An incredible accomplishment of art and technology blending together

content.label:
What a tribute to creativity! This game made me feel humbled at what can be achieved with great art, story and technology! 

I noted that after the first 15 minutes, I forgot that this was a game, and felt more like a rider on the Orient Express. Each character has been developed well, and the story unfolds in a non-linear way. This game was way ahead of its time when it came out, and I am so glad I was able to get my hands on it through the App Store. These guys deserve belated awards.
Good element of train themed mystery. Graphics are interesting. Railroad sounds are melodic.
Game seems fine , but I cant even enjoy since there is no audio, can't recommend at all.  From other reviews I see that's it's been a long term issue, and yet it's still around.
Just as I was excited to find Myst ports, I find this.

DotEmu needs to do some more quality assurance for this title. As other reviewers have stated, there are some awful glitches in the game. The game freezes and must be started over. But worst of all entire parts of the game are just missing and you can‚Äôt continue ‚Äì you just wait idly for nothing to happen.  Hints in the game do not work properly. They tell you to go to a cart to talk to people but there are not people in that cart and they never come. Deeply disappointing. Buyer beware.
One of the best adventure games ever made, and one of the least played. If you pick it up, though, it will be the best five dollars you've spent.

First off when I bought the game it wouldn't download even though I had enough storage available. Should have headed this as a warning. But I was eager the see how the game was and didn't want to waste $5. So after freeing up additional space it finally decided to download. The storyline is quite interesting as mystery games like this are hard to find. However the controls are less than great at best and I found them very annoying at first. However the most upsetting fact about this game is how glitchy it is. I have made progress in the game and then found myself being set back at least twice (primarily during chapter 3). There is no notification and all progress is just randomly lost. Unless the developers can fix this I can only see this adaptation of the game as a disappointment.
Great old game, brought back from the dead.
Would love to play it but it crashes on the Dotemu title screen.

Storyline is fantastic. I am a fan of point and click games and this did not disappoint. The only thing is the navigation in the game was a bit difficult and took a while to get used to. Other than that, excellent. I would play it again.

title.label: Took a few days to download

content.label: But so far, engrossing enough to be worth the $5

Story heavy, narrative driven puzzles yet puzzle-box light.

The real-time mechanics are brilliant and the atmosphere is without equal.

A must play.
Very interesting
Superbly captures the romance and mystery of the Orient Express. I hope to see more games like it!
An absolutely splendid adaptation of my favorite game ever.

for starters i'm a huge a.christie and those type of books and point&click adventure game fan, but this one let me down big time. i wasn't expecting much, but the graphics could definitely be better for a 2012 game. the gameplay is hard to control and even if you get used to it, it doesn't satisfy you at all, it is definitely a failure. other than these very bad gameplay and not even decent graphics, the story is nice and real time characters are a nice touch. but i'd say this isn't worth paying that much money, i only finished it cuz i paid it. i don't recommend this game at all for serious point&click adventure game players.
perfect except i cant play at work cus theres no subtitles ;(
This is great, just like it was when it first came out. Only a few iOS glitches (especially when you try to resume game after a break) but other than that no complaints.

title.label: Graphics might've been great...nearly 20 yrs ago...

content.label: What an incredible waste of $$$$$
Hasn't been easy to find over the years, especially Mac versions. Had to delete all my music off my phone to play but totally worth it.

This is really great. If you're a fan of point and click adventure games, this one's for you. The story is a little confusing at first, and you'll probably have to restart a few times to get to the end, but when you do you'll find the story really picks up. The touch sensitivity is a little off, but nothing horrible. And the fact that the whole game is in real time is great and really makes you think about your decisions. All in all this is pretty fantastic. Bravo.

This is a unique point and click adventure that has a truly engrossing story. It is unique because the other characters go about their business whether or not you decide to take action or not. This is different than most adventure games, where only your actions affect the events going on, but in this game, characters move and events unfold in real time, making it all the more immersive.  Definitely worth the buy if you enjoy period piece thrillers.
